website_summaries.verdict: They may have a fun appearance, but when it comes to peeling potatoes, these little tools mean business.
pros: With carbon steel blades, you can count on these peelers to glide through both soft and hard skins, and they won't lose their edge
Ambidextrous design can be used by anyone
Includes 3 peelers, so family members have no excuse not to help
cons: Blades need to be dried thoroughly to prevent rust

customer_reviews.title: Rusty after one washing.
customer_reviews.text: I like this style of peeler and was replacing something I had for years. I thought Kuhn Rikon was a pretty decent brand so I got this. After one round in the dish washer it started to rust. Now the blade is totally covered in rust and I'm throwing it away because I don't want metal in my food.
customer_reviews.author: constantbliss

customer_reviews.title: Beyond a doubt - the best
customer_reviews.text: As a longtime cook I am always on the outlook for the best, most efficient instruments. This automatically excludes 95% of items sold. This "French peeler" is near perfection. Why would anyone use anything differently? I can remove the skins of peaches, pears and mangos, slice cheese, peel and thinly slice potatoes...and the price can't be beat. The Kuhn, by the way, was selected as the best peeler of 2018 at 1/3 -1/4 the cost of higher end competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: I needed a really thin peel (no white from the lemon) and the Kuhn Rikon peeler was the absolute best. So
customer_reviews.text: We have worn out (after 10 years or so) this peeler and can't live without them. No one in our town had them in stock when our last one quit peeling properly, so we bought a couple different ones locally while these were on order. I needed to peel some lemons for limoncello so thought I would try all 3 types. I needed a really thin peel (no white from the lemon) and the Kuhn Rikon peeler was the absolute best. So, if you want thin peels, this is the set to get.
customer_reviews.author: Diane H.

customer_reviews.title: Vegetable Peelers.
customer_reviews.text: These peelers were on my Amazon list for a quite awhile. They were recommended by America'sTest Kitchen and Serious Food. I peeled a couple of middle-sized potatoes and the peeler easily did its job quite well. I wish the handles were at least an inch or two longer than they are and a bit heavier and thicker. I'd gladly take two peelers rather than three for the price if the handles were more comfortable to hold.
customer_reviews.author: ezreader

customer_reviews.title: It rusted
customer_reviews.text: I hand washed this peeler. Let it air dry and next day I noticed that it had rusted. Not really happy with the quality of it. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Healthnut

customer_reviews.title: Good for decorating, but not for a meal.
customer_reviews.text: Good for making decorative spirals but I was hoping to make zoodles for dinner without the waste of a spiralizer in the center of the veg, but this is too cumbersome for that. But for salads or decorating when you dont want to drag out the full sized spiralizer it is great.
customer_reviews.author: V. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Rusts in less then a month
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the product. It was even recommended my America’s Test Kitchen. The one I have had for over five years is better then this junk. Yes this blade was sharper because it’s new but this was very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Lhommedieu

customer_reviews.title: Where did rust come from.
customer_reviews.text: It was used two times and hand washed two times. Rust appeared all over it. I bought one for my mom as well and that one didn’t have rust. Nothing else was rusty to transfer the rust to the peeler. It must have been from peeler itself.
customer_reviews.author: Dario M.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best peeler ever made in this universe.
customer_reviews.text: This by far is the best f****** peeler ever created. I literally use it every day I'm at work. It can even handle sweet potatoes. The hole on the handle seriously makes it ergonomically superior to any peeler I've ever used (I'm a sous chef) and as long as you clean it after usage it WHICH YOU SHOULD ALWAYS DO 😠, it will last forever 😁
customer_reviews.author: Big Jules

customer_reviews.title: RUSTED almost instantly. You get what you pay for - going back to OXO
customer_reviews.text: We bought these because they were highly rated by America's Test Kitchen (I believe). We started seeing rust on these peelers within a couple months of purchase (after return window closed). We bought in January, it's now May and there is orange rust all over the peelers. We put them in the dishwasher & then back in the drawer, so there is occasionally a bit of wetness when we put them away - but NONE of our other kitchen tools have rusted, and why buy a cheap tool that's so high maintenance? We'll return to our OXO peeler - which we also find more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: This Chef says.....Dont't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these based on reviews. I need to remind myself that not all reviews are written by actual persons that bought the product. As a graduate of culinary school and lifelong hospitality worker, I sadly must say these peelers are "awful" the blade(s) continually break free and they stop functioning after about 90 days of use.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Chilelli

customer_reviews.title: The peeler rusts very quickly
customer_reviews.text: When the peeler was new, I was very happy with it. It was much better than the one I have previously used and was able to peel vegetables quickly and easily. I was very impressed. However 3 months down the line, without heavy use and only washed in the dishwasher without the hot water setting the peeler has managed to get rust on it. I havent seen this happen before! I don't think its safe to use with food now i might look up how to remove the rust or might just get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rusted and chipped after only a few uses and is now useless
customer_reviews.text: Read reviews on which peeler is the best and this one was recommended highly by Cook’s Illustrated. Sadly it rusted after a few uses and washed in dishwasher. You can also see in the pictures the chips in the blade. I have never had a peeler rust! I have a fabulous palm peeler that I continue to use for 8+ years. This one is going in the trash after one month of use. *Note - small print says do not wash in the dishwasher. Wish that was somewhere in bold and capital print as all my other peeler has been thru many dishwasher cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Renaissance Juggler

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! The angle of the blade is way off! Won't peel a carrot, potato, or an apple. My daughter cut herself trying to peel an apple when the blade broke off of the cheap plastic handle. Mine are already in the garbage. Get a metal one!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN SWITZERLAND - Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE THE BEST. MADE IN SWITZERLAND. High quality. Have been using them for years, and I peel potatoes, yams, apples, carrots, etc. EVERYDAY. They stay sharp and do a great job. Lightweight and comfortable. If you keep them dry, they remain rust-free. If they ever do get rust spots, just soak them in vinegar and it comes off. Great price, so I just bought 3 more to put away for the future. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Nice shape and sharp blades, but not high quality handle
customer_reviews.text: I like the shape of these peelers, and the blades are nicely sharp. But, I've already had one come apart and is not repairable. The blade popped out and the plastic holder is too loose to hold it. The plastic handle is very cheap. It is hollow on the back side, and doesn't sit pleasantly in your hand. I think the plastic handles could be a lot better. But, that aside, the peelers work well and are inexpensive. These are ideal for someone who will frequently replace their peelers so as to have very sharp blades.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Mountain LGH

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm and is a great price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always used this peeler and for a reason. I can’t seem to switch because time and time again, these have always been my favorite. The one I used for many years starting wearing down and this value pack was exactly what I needed. The price is very reasonable, and no surprise, it works Great. It’s so easy to maneuver. It flawlessly peels flat broad surfaces, up to bumpy, tricky surfaces like a very lumpy potato or ginger - no problem. All in all, it’s my personal favorite. It shipped on time, nicely packaged, no defect on the item, and to this day, after countless dishwasher cycles/hand washes, they’re holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and worked well, but not better than other brand-new peelers, despite recommendation from America's Test Kitchen (Cook's Country?). There's no type of hand/finger guard, so usage is no safer for fingers than any other peeler. After only 2nd use, I put it in dishwasher with heated dry cycle. Came out VERY rusted. Seller's response was good and fast. They required a photo, but processed a refund right away. Maybe if immediately hand-washed and hand-dried the tool wouldn't have rusted, but that requires more care than stainless steel peelers, and I don't want to shred towels or fingers by hand-drying a sharp blade.
customer_reviews.author: W-RO

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love!
customer_reviews.text: I used to work in kitchens professionally, and we always used u-shaped peelers. Despite growing up using a standard "stick" peeler, I simply cannot use them anymore. These peelers are fantastic!! They fit perfectly in my hand, they have the notch on the end to remove bad spots from potatoes/veggies, and they're super lightweight. I personally just hand scrub them and dry them on our dish rack, but I'm sure you could pop them in the dishwasher as well. We've been using the 1 peeler for 2 months and it's showing zero signs of rust, wear or tear. At this rate, these 3 peelers will last me years to come. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Faith D.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Have had these for less than 2 months and they are already rusted and one of them has a broken blade. Cheap plastic, they don't feel solid in your hand, blades that rust almost instantly, and blades that fall off easily. Broke one blade just trying to re-install it. Pretty disappointing quality from Kuhn Rikon. I guess this is a classic case of "you get what you pay for". Don't waste your money on this and spend a little more for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: GoBlue88

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, cheap, great for garnishes
customer_reviews.text: After messing around with a dozen different products to peel good looking garnishes for drinks, I finally broke down and bought these. I initially avoided them because of how inexpensive they were and how cheap-plastic they looked. My mistake. Turns out the inexpensive plastic one has the sharpest blades, made the cleanest cuts with minimal effort. I've given away all my other veggie peelers and now use these for everything - fruits, vegetables, and they even work for shaving wood and foam. With three colors in one package, I can dedicate one unit to each activity so there's never confusion about which has done what. Win-win-win.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: I bought this peeler as a late night whim. I was watching cooking videos and reading recipes and one blogger raved about this special potato peeler. So, with judgement impaired by sleep deprivation, I immediately ordered the magic potato peeler. It's ok. It's nothing special. When I reach into my kitchen drawer, I will use it if the one I bought at the grocery store is not in sight. The blade is sharp enough. But the handle is uninspired. I definitely would not want to peel potatoes for a large party with this peeler. It's good enough for an occasional use. It's all you should expect from a $5 peeler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace a swiss zyliss I'd had for ten years or so that finally broke at the blade. No opinion on durability, but there is three in the package for less than half what I paid for the other ten years ago. Works very well, and I tend to use it much more often than my "knife" style peeler. Easy clean-up. Not sure what all the fuss is about the carbon blade. Mu use has been trouble free. I would certainly buy again, but I would be in my nineties by the time I would need to, so maybe not.
customer_reviews.author: Donald R. Whittington

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This peeler hesitates when peeling yet it’s sharp. Like those knives that were sharpened with a rough sharpener. I’ve peeled off bits of my nails a few times. I ordered these on recommendations from the internet but didn’t expect to dislike it due to the blades. I ended up ordering “OXO Good Grips Swivel Peeler” and it was amazing!
customer_reviews.author: ZB

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer here. Love this peeler!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand more than 20 years ago in Table Talk, a kitchen store, and that is how long my peeler lasted. I bought the new one, peeled off the blue protective strip from the blades, and went to town on some cucumber peeling. Still the same great product. It's super sharp and easy to use. I like it much better with the blade at this horizontal angle than traditional peelers with a vertical orientation during use. I like it that there are three of them in the package. The order came super fast, too!
customer_reviews.author: Eve Paludan

customer_reviews.title: Best peeler money can buy.
customer_reviews.text: After having used one of these little peelers at a friend's house many years ago, she gave me two to take home. This has to be at least 20 years ago... One of the peelers was "borrowed" by one of my daughters when she left for college (not sure what happened to the other... the other daughter perhaps?). Anyway, it finally broke just before Christmas. She had been using it for over 10 years! She even messaged me a photo of her holding the "corpse"..... These three should last us another 30 years or so!!
customer_reviews.author: Claire Bureau

customer_reviews.title: Blade Quality Has Gotten Worse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this peeler a couple years ago and loved it. It stayed sharp for a long time, and didn't rust. I bought this peeler a few months ago and did NOT love it. It oxidized and rusted after the first use. This company must currently use poorer-quality metal than they did a couple years ago. I don't care what some reviews are saying about this peeler being an "industry standard" and needing to be hand-dried. A peeler should not need to be hand-dried to prevent rusting. You don't need a culinary degree to see that the blade is poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Finally one even I can use!!
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to use. It is sharp and comfortable for small hands. Have used it on apples and vegetables as large as eggplants. I thought I was simply challenged, as I could never use these things correctly. This peeler is a dream!! And . . . it's small size makes it easy to store in my gadgets drawer. Very reasonably priced for the value. Thank you sooo much! I highly recommend this for others who have difficulty using peelers
customer_reviews.author: Northern Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Super efficient and sharp peelers
customer_reviews.text: These veg peelers are excellent- light, sharp and easy to use. The design is a direct pull- as opposed to a side pull peeler. I find this is easier on the hands especially when doing larger jobs. I also like that these peelers are sold in a three pack so there are a few peelers on hand when extra help is available for peeling big batches of potatoes. The swivel blade adjusts with hand angle and does not remove too much of the fruit or vegetable. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: This thing is tiny.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this item for a couple reasons. First, the color in the picture is not the same as I received. Secondly, this thing is tiny. I can’t even hold it to use it. I have to pinch it with two fingers and your hand is going to get tired really fast. I generally love Kuhn Rikon products but this one is a fail.
customer_reviews.author: Outta Control

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, very sharp, work great.
customer_reviews.text: These are really inexpensive, the blades are very sharp, and they work very well. Yes, I throw them through the dishwasher. If there has been any rusting, I haven't noticed. They still work just fine. They're really holding their edge well, much better than any other cheap peeler I've had. They do remove narrow slices, that's true -- but the sharpness means you can peel things really quickly regardless. They are easy to hold and use.
customer_reviews.author: Winged Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Rusts
customer_reviews.text: When they say hand wash immediately they mean it. This thing rusts easily. Works great, but wash and dry quickly. Would try another brand that is dishwasher safe before buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Loving Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for carrots
customer_reviews.text: I like to peel my carrots (not everyone does!) and these are excellent for carrots: they remove only a thin amount; most peelers take off too much. They do rust a bit, and although that might trouble some people, it is not at all bothersome for me. Others who use my kitchen have various preferences for peelers, so I keep a variety in the drawer, but as for me, when it comes to carrots, I love love love these peelers.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Person

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy them if you live in Florida
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good, but blades rusted even when dried thoroughly and stored in a clean, dry utility drawer in my kitchen. I mean I do live in FL, so it is humid, but that's some cheap metal. Had to throw them away. If you live in a dryer climate, probably work.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Wood

customer_reviews.title: It will Rust no matter what you do...
customer_reviews.text: If you wash it by hand, it rusts. If you just clean it off with a hand towel, it's rusts. It cannot be reasoned with, It cannot be stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Welk

customer_reviews.title: Great little guys
customer_reviews.text: These peelers are really great and very well-worth their low price. The blade is extremely sharp and has a bit of a pivot to it, so it makes peeling a curved or uneven surface very easy. I wash and dry them after each use, and they last for a long time. Eventually one will get a bit of rust on it, at which point I toss it out and start using another one. The last set I bought lasted me more than two years. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Brophy

customer_reviews.title: Best peeler ever, & I’ve had lots of them
customer_reviews.text: I love this peeler! I’ve spent my life using the rod style of peeler (I’m 75), and can’t believe how much quicker & easier this kind is. I just finished peeling carrots, parsnips, potatoes and butternut squash (softened a bit in microwave before peeling). Amazing how fast it goes. One swipe does the entire length of a carrot, parsnip or potato. The squash took a little longer, but still a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Jongoma2

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels like a cheap toddlers play kitchen gadgettoy
customer_reviews.text: Good grief...yall, don't make my mistake and order this flimsy, tiny little piece of junk. It looks like a toddlers play kitchen gadget toy. It looks as though it were made for a 3 year old! Super small, lightweight, thin plastic. Don't buy this...you'll regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened to the rust comments
customer_reviews.text: Hand washed, immediately dried, immediately rusted. I've never had a peeler rust so much so quickly. UPDATE: I threw this away and purchased the OXO Good Grips Y Peeler  which has held up well for 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: UVReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a week
customer_reviews.text: The peeler is very light, easy to use and cuts a very thin slice off of the item being peeled. We used it on carrots, parsnips and apples. We ordered it and another peeler recommended by Americas Test Kitchen, and we alternated using the peelers. Unfortuately, on our third or fourth use of the Kuhn peeler, the plastic that holds the peeler blade in place gave way and the peeler is no longer usable. Disappointed. The other peeleris still working well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1 of 3 Missing Blade - Otherwise work OK
customer_reviews.text: Received item and 1 of 3 was missing a blade entirely, checked and it was not in the package and didn't fall off. Now tried to return and get a replacement and am getting an "item not valid for return" message! Tried one of the other 2 and they work good. Saw these as recommendations from the "Salt.Fat.Acid.Heat" documentary and they work well. Poor quality control apparently!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mantis

customer_reviews.title: Finally something sharp enough to work well
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about these peelers. Have only used one so far of the three and I consider this one of my best finds. So quick to peel carrots now and they don't take off so much as my vertical peeler. Some people spoke of rusting, I have not had this problem. I do not put it in the dishwasher or leave it amongst the peelings while I do other things. I peel, wash and dry. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pam30

customer_reviews.title: handle is too short for an adult
customer_reviews.text: This device is sharp and nice BUT I think the Keebler elves designed the handle because I can only fit like 3 fingers around it - it doesn't fit my hand enough to give good leverage. If you have super tiny hands or you want your small children to help peel potatoes this will work - otherwise it is just a backup peeler to my backup peeler and sitting in my drawer
customer_reviews.author: Steven L

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about these at first - small and cheap, and I have always preferred the long straight peelers instead of this design. But I am VERY pleased with these after using them. For things like asparagus, the long peelers are clumsy to use, and these work perfectly with the spear laying on a cutting board instead of held in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Mauser

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly effective!
customer_reviews.text: I can now peel butternut squash as easy as butter! They are VERY light and feel cheap, but they work amazingly well! I had never used this style before, but I will not go back to the old ways anymore. Very happy with this purchase and would definitely buy them again and recommend to friends in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Linda C

customer_reviews.title: Rust after just a month
customer_reviews.text: This peeler rusted already after just one month of use (look at the pictures). I would not recommend buying this. I don't feel it's safe to use on food anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Chun Yat Li

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after one day
customer_reviews.text: ... literally rusted after one wash, what a waste of money. I have purchased this product in a different brand name before and it worked perfectly. Unfortunately amazon only serves this product under this brand name and it is terrible. Why purchase something when you will only be able to use it one time? Tools that are easily rust-able should not be allowed to be used on food! It’s a poison to the body? Is that what you want? Don’t buy it. One of them ( the red) I didn’t even wash yet... and it has rust on it. Disgusting. Product is defective and I’d like my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Giavonna Pulido

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable but not top of the line
customer_reviews.text: I only use Y peelers and it was time to replace my current one. These came recommended. They are super lightweight although not really flimsy, I’d prefer a heftier handle. Length of the handle is fine for my small hands but I would think someone with larger hands may prefer a longer handle. Blades are super sharp and work well even on citrus peels.
customer_reviews.author: Weterman

customer_reviews.title: Just THE BEST EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: We had this product for many years. We got it on sale years ago from Target. We accidentally lost it. I was very sad. I believed that we will not find the same product with the same quality. I was wrong!!! This time we got a package of 3, just in case, and they are just THE BEST!!! I really don't know what products got the people with bad reviews on this item and how they use it. My only advise will be use it, wash it and dry it with a kitchen towel then that's it ...use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Marcoprestige

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: After washing it once, I left it with my other dishes to dry, and now there's a spot of rust on it. Also it is pretty small (about 5 inches and the handle is is little over half of that.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy E'lan

customer_reviews.title: Get these and no others
customer_reviews.text: Razor sharp. Effortless action. Will take paper thin slices off your veggies and huge planks of citrus zest with no pith. Cheaper than dirt. 3 to a pack. Clean them in the dishwasher, ruin them in a couple years, buy 3 more for $10. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: J. Leitch

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve purchased several other Kuhn Rikon kitchen products and been happy. Had high hopes for these... only to be disappointed. First off, the metal “cutting” bar broke within a few weeks. You got three so wasn’t the end of the world. However, the other two have begun rusting badly and another one looks as though it could break at any moment. They’re inexpensive and cut well, but save yourself the hassle of having to replace all 3 in a few months. Purchase a different set.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M Shinkle

customer_reviews.title: Rusty Blade
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these peelers a week and I love the way they peel vegetables and fruits, however, the blades on all 3 are rusty already....and no, I didn't put them in the dishwasher or soak them in the sink for a long period of time. Disappointed in the product for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Irwin Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, if feeling a little Mattel
customer_reviews.text: I very much like this style of peeler. My old one broke (ceramic blade) and these came to replace it. They work well, do everything I need. Even if they feel a bit like toys. Superlight weight plastic, slender blades. No complaints about the performance. The feel of holding them simply takes getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: W. L. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Must-have tool for the healthy eater
customer_reviews.text: Love these and have discarded my old-fashioned skinny vegetable peeler. This design is far better! I garden and try to eat lots of fresh foods. These work great for peeling everything, but I especially love them for thick-skinned butternut squash which I grow and cook a lot. My only caveat is that with the wide cutting area, be careful! I recommend these along with inexpensive cut-resistant gloves when preparing vegetables or fruit (yep, I learned the hard way). The combination of this peeler with gloves will make your prep time fly!
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: The only peeler worth considering.
customer_reviews.text: The Kuhn Rikon remains the best peeler on Earth. I've worked in pro kitchens for 12 years and everyone know this is the correct peeler to carry in your knife bag. Other horizontal or "Y" peelers usually have something off about the leverage or the depth of the cut. They may be plastic but they're durable, I've yet to see one break, and the blade stays sharp for years. If you want a fancy one get the metal Kuhn, but the 3 pack is awesome because you can have a backup and one to give to a fellow cook.
customer_reviews.author: letitburn

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for your favorite foodie
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended on a podcast I listen to as a great gift for your favorite foodie - Super sharp once you get the hang of holding it differently than a traditional peeler this is fabulous. Plus it comes in a multi pack of three in fun colors so you can share with somebody else Who would appreciate it
customer_reviews.author: Kristen H.

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight plastic item arrived damaged (and unwrapped) in a plastic bag. I cannot attest to its usability as the handle has razor sharp plastic sticking out that makes it impossible to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel HB

customer_reviews.title: It did a great job of peeling a ripe pear
customer_reviews.text: This puny plastic thing arrived in the mail. It is as sharp as a razor, so one must be careful not to bump one's knuckles as you use it. The handle design makes it almost impossible to use it with a motion away from you. It does peel well, but it is dangerous to use and The sharpness doesnt last. The design also prevents removing pits on the potato surface the way you would with the tip of a conventional peeler. It did a great job of peeling a ripe pear, but I caught my knuckles twice. I wouldnt buy it again. I am upset that COOKS ILLUSRATED promoted it. I will not longer rely on their reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Doonan

customer_reviews.title: They fit nicely in the hand and are resilient for such lightweight ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought because I wore out my old Rikon peeler. They fit nicely in the hand and are resilient for such lightweight material. The blade remains sharp for years, and I used the old one frequently in a professional kitchen. What I especially like is that the peeler is so lightweight that I can store it sideways at the end of my magnetic knife rack. I have a very tiny home kitchen so any way I can save on space is huge for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael de Vera

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, sharp and durable
customer_reviews.text: It's the best. The blade stays sharp even after a year of near daily light use. I wash it with soap and hot water by hand and leave it to air dry. The blade has a little rust but does not affect its performance. I have tried other ones on Amazon that had similar ratings, but they are not as sharp out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: WWC

customer_reviews.title: amazing and disappointing all at the same time
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this peeler... HOWEVER, it MUST be dried immediately or it WILL rust. I'm a bit frustrated by this. The peeler does an excellent job and the eye remover is convenient and easy to use. I will just have to be really careful with the peeler and make sure I wash AND dry immediately to prevent rust. :(
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because a handful on for reviews mentioned that it’s the choice product for Chef’s. My husband, a chef, hates these enough to throw them away and buy a replacement. I don’t mind them for the price. But, they did start immediately rusting in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: jessica a bois

customer_reviews.title: The BEST peeler in the universe!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the only peeler I will ever use, I was so happy to find them on Amazon. Whew! Last quite a long time, eventually the blades do get rusty from washing and use and you need to replace the whole thing, I'm talking about like after 4 years though. These are so easy use, lightweight and super sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Cbev

customer_reviews.title: Great Peeler for Little Hands
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher and love to cook with my kids. These little peelers on the smaller side so are great for young children through elementary school. Four year olds were able to easily peel carrots after just a minute or two of modeling and instruction. We've only used them a couple times so I can't attest to how well they will hold up but they seem to be of average sturdiness so if they are taken care of I'm hoping to get quite a bit of use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S.

customer_reviews.title: The BEST peelers EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I looked all over for these. My Mom had them years ago. These can peel an EGGPLANT in a JIFF!! That is the ultimate test for me. So when I lost the last one I had, I went here and YEAH ,, I found them. WHAT A LOW PRICE for such an amazing peeler. They look like they won't work. They are so lightweight and easy. THEY ARE BY FAR MY FAVORITE PEELERS.
customer_reviews.author: Angela G.

customer_reviews.title: Got a garbage piece
customer_reviews.text: I know everybody is raving about this peeler but mine is pure garbage. I also have the feeling it was used before. The blades are full of rust. Will not even attempt to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blades rusted after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted a y peeler for quite awhile. These were smaller than I thought they would be (maybe 5 inches in length) so I was hesitant at first. But they work great! My old peeler took off too thick a slice when peeling, these take off a much thinner slice and make quick work of peeling. I was in love with this product for about 2 months. Then I noticed the rust forming on the blade of each one. Now mind you, I cook a lot and thus these are used almost daily, but my old peeler is at least 10 years old with no signs of rust. I expected more from Kuhn Rikon.
customer_reviews.author: AAW

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Great peeler, fits well in my hand and peels root vegetables with ease. Have not had any issues with the blade rusting, but I am sure to wash and dry it right away after use. I like the fact that the blade is metal and black in color, so it won't develop stains like the white ceramic one it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: CaiusM

customer_reviews.title: What The Pros Use
customer_reviews.text: I'm a culinary school graduate and have worked in Michelin starred kitchens and these are the peelers that are used, universally. They're cheap, sharp, and work great! Don't waste money on an expensive peeler, use these until they get dull, throw it out, and grab another. Do dry them though as they will rust with time.
customer_reviews.author: Robin H

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I received these as an addon gift from our wedding registry almost 4 years ago. Our last pair was still working extremely well, but we unfortunately lost them in the move. These are the BEST peelers I've ever used. Everyone that I have allowed to try them out adamantly agrees with me. I have never encountered a vegetable peeler of this quality. Our last pair was showing no sign of actual wear after years of continual use.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Teall

customer_reviews.title: If I could have given this zero stars I would have. It rusted within weeks of using it.
customer_reviews.text: If I could have given this zero stars I would have. It rusted within weeks of using it. It's very light weight and feels very flimsy. It was sharp I will give it that but despite hand washing and drying it was all rusted within a few weeks making it unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hold and use for diabetic hands
customer_reviews.text: Love these I have very bad hands these make peeling veggie so much easier I can even manage some potatoes I hadn't been able to for years without pain and swelling even my teen daughter likes them bc and the bright colors that match her cutting board
customer_reviews.author: Angela Sieg

customer_reviews.title: Glad to find this item
customer_reviews.text: Nothing I've used works as well as a Swiss Peeler. My old one was either thrown away by mistake or went out into the compost with old vegetable scraps. I was lost without it. I had a couple of old standard peelers which functioned poorly. Glad to find this item. Highly recommend. Inexpensive and peels like a dream! Happy, I am.
customer_reviews.author: M Send

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST PEELER OUT THERE!
customer_reviews.text: These are THE BEST peelers I have ever used! My mother-in-law had a very old one that still worked incredibly, so I had to get some for myself. All other peelers I’ve owned (including a fancy Kitchen Aid one) don’t work well and make my hand hurt because of how awkward it is to hold them. These are so comfortable, so sharp, and peel so well and so quickly. I will never buy another peeler again!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Nevienski

customer_reviews.title: Poor design for kids- hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased after watching America test kitchen vote it best for kids. I do not think it’s best for my kids. It’s very difficult to use and I am fearful my kids may cut their fingers while holding the fruit they are trying to peel. I think it’s a poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set of these in 2015 and they have been used regularly. No issues with rust, stayed sharp, and surprisingly strong for a little plastic peeler. Buying another set now because we somehow lost 2 of the 3 and the 3rd is finally getting a little dull.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rusts too Easily
customer_reviews.text: The issue for me was how easily this thing rusted; after just one use the blades rusted and, while I was able to clean them, they kept rusting and eventually I threw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: These are the best!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many vegetable peelers and still find the Swiss design the easiest to use with my small hands. They are durable but eventually (years later) the blade dulls, but they are so reasonable in price that I don't mind replacing them.
customer_reviews.author: Harborlou

customer_reviews.title: Great reviews, Great Peeler.  Like a lot, not love.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what all the fuss is about. Many tv shows rave about this little peeler and they're right...it's nice. It's 10,000 times better than a grocery store peeler and 100,000 times better than some of the gimmicky alternatives, but to "love it?" I'd expect a slightly larger handle and more robust build. It's not delicate or flimsy at all but the lightness makes it feel like a toy. The blade is beautiful and super sharp. Beautiful. Not made in China so I wish I could give it 6 stars.
customer_reviews.author: akamenth

customer_reviews.title: Replace your old peeler with one of these
customer_reviews.text: I noticed chefs on Bravos Top Chef using these. I have been using Oxo peelers for years and I thought they were great until I used these for the first time. They are extremely sharp and make peeling a breeze. They are small so they fit in your hands great. I read all of the reviews about rust and like all good kitchen tools just make sure you hand wash and I dry right away. Going to reorder to give to other friends and family that cook.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as sharp or as easy to use as some of the better peelers
customer_reviews.text: I expected more from these peelers, but they are somewhat cumbersome to use and are not as sharp, nor peel potatoes as easily as some of my better peelers. I will try to continue to use them but not as often as I thought and hoped I would.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun GourmetTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Junk! Rusted after 1 use.
customer_reviews.text: Rusted out after 1 time through the dishwasher. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great but watch out for rest
customer_reviews.text: These peelers are exceptionally sharp, lightweight and all-around great – but know they rust immediately. No matter how quickly you dry the blade, they seem to rust. I think that might be why there is a three pack for sale! I would avoid the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: J. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Immediately Returned
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this was not what I was expecting. It was child size, and I have small hands. I didn't remove from it's sealed plastic bag. It looked like it would easily break and the handle did not feel good to hold through the bag. I have returned.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS is what you want! Don't look any further!!! I've been searching for the best peeler forever; I tried the beautiful expensive metal one and returned it....this is VERY sharp, so very safe, (or not, depending, BUT, a dull knife is the most dangerous tool in the kitchen!) You will not be sorry you bought these! Just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Rusted 🙁
customer_reviews.text: They are easy to use, but the blades on mine rusted on the first wash (after being rinsed). I’m disappointed that it would rust on first use.
customer_reviews.author: BH456

customer_reviews.title: This peeler...
customer_reviews.text: The peeling blade fell out a couple times, but this far have been able to pop it right back in with no difficulty. Great otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Nnely T

customer_reviews.title: Good, sharp peelers but rusted very quickly
customer_reviews.text: See the other reviews here.. these peelers rust if they even go near water. We opened all 3 but only used 1-2 of them regularly and all 3 ended up rusted within 2 months. Thankfully was able to return to Amazon and will look for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: tech dad

customer_reviews.title: GETS RUSTY QUICK
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6 month old baby whom I make my own baby food for so I needed a peeler that was quick and easy to use. This peeler does exactly that but the reason I put 2 stars is because it rusts REALLY fast. Within a couple weeks of use (maybe about 4 washes in the sink), the blade was completely rusted and the black paint on the blade was chipping off. I’m obviously not going to use this for anything now which is really disappointing because it really was a good project. Being easy to handle and sharp made things quick and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Darrian Heinreich

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this peeler!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is, in my opinion, the best peeler I've ever used. It's VERY sharp and easy to use....I can go thru a bag of potatoes or apples in a jiffy, as well as pears, kiwi, carrots, cucumbers....anything that you need to peel. I highly recommend....and very economical as well. Treat it as a good knife and don't put it in the dishwasher....it will stay sharp for a very long time
customer_reviews.author: Mama M

customer_reviews.title: It really is better
customer_reviews.text: I wondered if a new peeler would matter. I saw this reviewed by chefs as amazing. Well they were right. Its small light and sharp but not dangerous. It IS actually the best Ive used. Inexpensive and efficient. Who knew.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Villeneuve

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little peelers!
customer_reviews.text: For being extremely lightweight & looking "flimsy" (for lack of a better word), these are awesome little peelers. I tackled 7 large apples for a dessert dish & these peeled quickly & easily. They're far more maneuverable than you would expect & VERY sharp. And you can't beat the price. America's Test Kitchen was right - these are great!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E Tongier

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Super sharp and stays that way. Perfect—so happy I found these. Having the right peeler makes all the difference in not loosing so much of the fruit or veggie to peeling. I had looked for a good one every time I was in a kitchen department. So happy I found these. My search is over!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: You need these if you cook!
customer_reviews.text: Home cooks - get rid of your peeler and get a cheap, 3 pack of sharp Y peelers. I can’t believe I never used these before - they make light work of any veggie, cheese, etc. you can palm what you’re peeling too - allowing for full strokes and quicker peeling.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: If you have big hands beware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it resembled my Swissmar peeler that broke and I was too lazy to read the my original peeler was Swissmar! These peelers are quality but the handle is short and uncomfortable for a guy with big hands. I returned them and got Swissmars.
customer_reviews.author: R Erbe

customer_reviews.title: Not the Real Thing?
customer_reviews.text: This Kuhn Rikon set is my 3rd purchase (not all from Amazon though). Previous one was a Dual Peeler. Loved it! Performed well whether peeling soft or thick-skinned fruits/vegetables. Hand washed/air dried. Stayed sharp for years!This set was quite disappointing! I raved and shared with my coworkers about Kuhn Rikon peelers. Now, I'm embarrassed that these 3 in the set all rusted. Definitely don't want to use these peeler blades on fruits and vegetables. Stainless steel blades or something else?
customer_reviews.author: C. S.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but well made
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these since my one favorite peeler seemed to always be in the dishwasher. I just received them and like the blades the most. They've sharp and work well. I don't know yet how durable they'll be, but at the price I'll just replace them when they stop working well. The handles are rather light weight and a bit short. If you have large hands, you may want something a bit more substantial. I like the eye scoop, but I'm a lefty, so it's on the wrong side for me. Like many things I have to adapt for that. Maybe the manufacturer will consider putting one on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Dorcas

customer_reviews.title: Rusted
customer_reviews.text: It rusted after the second use. There are a lot of potato peelers out there, so I can't imagine why you'd need to put up with this one. We got an OXO for a dollar more and it's managed to both (1) peel potatoes and (2) not rust, so if I'm running these numbers correctly, that's almost double the value.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R

customer_reviews.title: Cheap But Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: This peeler does not work for me. I now see a warning not to wash it in the dishwasher. I did, primarily because I did not want to cut myself on the blades while washing. It did not stand up. The blade seems much duller. Takes a lot of effort to use. Admittedly, my hands are weak, but I think spending more for a better peeler would be worth it..
customer_reviews.author: Fran S.

product_meta.title: Kuhn Rikon Original Swiss Peeler 3-Pack Red/Green/Yellow
product_meta.description: Size:Set of 3| Color:Red/Green/YellowThis best-selling peeler has a featherweight design, and heavyweight performance. Razor-sharp carbon steel blades tackle fruits, vegetables and potatoes with minimum fuss. It also has a convenient integrated potato eye remover and is ergonomically designed to fit in the left or right hand. This set comes with three straight bladed peelers in Red, green and Yellow.
feature_bullets: Handy set of 3 peelers in different colors
Super-sharp carbon steel blade cuts better that most other peelers and stays sharp
Ergonomic design works in right or left hand
Carbon steel horizontal Y blade with convenient potato eye remover
Do not wash in dishwasher. Peelers are NOT Dishwasher safe. Hand wash and dry only

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars7,120 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
